title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
abusenius joined #xwiki at 00:05  
cjdelisle` - (01:48): Looks like cjdelisle, must be cjdelisle...  
venkatna joined #xwiki at 03:45  
venkatna left at 03:46 (Client Quit  
venkatna joined #xwiki at 03:46  
Menso1 left at 04:23 (Quit: Leaving.  
venkatna left at 04:51 (Ping timeout: 265 seconds  
venkatna joined #xwiki at 04:52  
abusenius left at 05:07 (Ping timeout: 255 seconds  
Denis left at 06:01 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
Denis joined #xwiki at 06:09  
vmassol joined #xwiki at 07:55  
mflorea joined #xwiki at 07:56  
sabageru joined #xwiki at 08:41  
sburjan joined #xwiki at 08:44  
sburjan - (08:54): morning : FYI I will test 2.7 snapshot today  
vmassol - (08:56): sburjan: ok cool. We need to release ASAP though (before your results)  
vmassol - (08:56): we are now 1 week late :(  
sburjan - (08:56): I know :(  
vmassol - (08:56): I've seen that jerome committed some important stuff over the week end  
vmassol - (08:56): let's hope nothing was broken and it was ok  
sburjan - (08:57): I have a question : In order to organize my activity better and to better know when we have a release, is  there any always-updated canlendar on releases ?  
vmassol - (08:57): yes of course  
sburjan - (08:57): I want to organize myself better  
vmassol - (08:57): several  
vmassol - (08:57): the first one is the roadmap  
vmassol - (08:57): here:  
vmassol - (08:57): enterprise.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Roadmap  
vmassol - (08:58): this is the best source  
vmassol - (08:58): then there's the jira calendar  
vmassol - (08:59): we need to remember to update the jira one  
vmassol - (08:59): we usually forget to update it  
vmassol - (08:59): anyay the Roadmap page is always the best source  
sburjan - (08:59): thanks. I'll bookmark it and use it as a reference  
vmassol - (09:00): updating the jira calendar now  
sburjan - (09:00): I guess we will release directly 2.7RC2  
vmassol - (09:01): I don't know  
vmassol - (09:01): sergiu is the release manager  
vmassol - (09:01): :(  
vmassol - (09:01): I guess there won't be any RC2  
sburjan - (09:02): so we're moving to final instead. This will require  hardcore testing  
vmassol - (09:03): not more than usual  
vmassol - (09:03): it's a small release  
vmassol - (09:03): a stabilization one  
vmassol - (09:03): but yes :)  
vmassol - (09:03): especially since it's the last minor release of the 2.x cycle  
vmassol - (09:03): jira calendar updated  
sburjan - (09:04): I have another suggestion. Would it be morea easy and transparent If I create a page somewhere and use some check boxes in order to see what I've tested ? Something similar like we have on the release page which the release manager has to check when he releases a module.  
vmassol - (09:04): yes  
sburjan - (09:04): so everybody can see the progress of testing ...  
vmassol - (09:04): it's called a test plan  
vmassol - (09:04): it's good to have one  
sburjan - (09:05): ok. I will create on while testing for 2.7. I will show it to you in order to get some feedback  
vmassol - (09:05): send it to the dev lists  
vmassol - (09:05): make sure you start with the exsiting one  
vmassol - (09:05): http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/Testing#HManualtesting  
vmassol - (09:06): please review this too: http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/ManualTestStrategy  
vmassol - (09:06): test plan is here: http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/ManualTestPlan  
vmassol - (09:06): please update it and present a version to it to the devs list  
sburjan - (09:07): okay.  
jstoldt joined #xwiki at 09:12  
xwikibot joined #xwiki at 09:21  
jstoldt - (09:24): what's the status on 2.7 RC1?  
jstoldt - (09:24): will it arrive today?  
vmassol - (09:25): jstoldt: we need to ask sergiu. ATM it's been delayed by 1 week  
jstoldt - (09:25): yep  
jstoldt - (09:25): well, i'll wait for him then :)  
vmassol - (09:29): sburjan: found this too: http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Drafts/TestingWatchListScheduler  
vmassol - (09:30): please provide a direction for that doc too  
vmassol - (09:30): (either include it or discard it)  
sburjan - (09:32): vmassol: okay  
vmassol - (09:44): sburjan: there are lots of docs on http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Drafts/ related to the test plan that need be integrated in the overall test plan you're preparing  
sburjan - (09:44): okay. I will take a look at them too  
sburjan - (09:44): and try to make a merge  
vmassol - (09:44): (you should talk to silvia about it too since she's the one who started them)  
vmassol - (09:44): ok thanks

tmortagne left at 11:15 (Ping timeout: 240 seconds  
sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 11:17  
tmortagne joined #xwiki at 11:19  
sburjan left at 11:25 (Ping timeout: 264 seconds  
tmortagne1 joined #xwiki at 11:30  
tmortagne left at 11:32 (Ping timeout: 260 seconds  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 11:35  
jstoldt - (11:38): hey sdumitriu, what's the status on 2.7 RC1?  
vmassol - (11:44): lucaa: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Features/FeaturesExtract converted to 2.0 syntx using the new container macro :)  
vmassol - (11:44): check the source!  
sdumitriu - (11:45): vmassol: what's the status on the events refactoring?  
lucaa - (11:45): why do the images take so long to load/  
lucaa - (11:45): ?  
lucaa - (11:45): is it my internet?  
vmassol - (11:45): sdumitriu: no idea, jerome did it  
vmassol - (11:45): I think it's done  
lucaa - (11:46): vmassol: should we justify the text?  
vmassol - (11:46): I need to make all image absolute now  
vmassol - (11:47): lucaa: I don't think so  
vmassol - (11:47): we can try though  
vmassol - (11:47): but first I need to fix all the thinfs I've broken  
vmassol - (11:47): :)  
vmassol - (11:47): lucaa: you're editing?  
vmassol - (11:47): can I force the lock?  
lucaa - (11:47): I was trying to have a little look  
lucaa - (11:47): but you can force  
lucaa - (11:47): my internet is too slow for that  
vmassol - (11:47): (view>source)  
vmassol - (11:47): ;)  
vmassol - (11:48): (yeah I know I do the same… )  
vmassol - (11:48): I need to make all images aboslutenow  
lucaa - (11:48): no, no justify, it looks like crap with  
lucaa - (11:48): I looked at the source with view source  
lucaa - (11:48): I was trying out the justify  
lucaa - (11:48): but it looks bad with  
vmassol - (11:48): since the new include won't work iwth relative images  
vmassol - (11:48): tmortagne1: I wonder if that's good  
vmassol - (11:49): it means a lot more typin  
vmassol - (11:49): maybe there's a need for a context or a new param  
vmassol - (11:49): so that all refs are resolved from the included doc  
vmassol - (11:49): wdyt?  
sburjan joined #xwiki at 11:49  
tmortagne1 - (11:50): vmassol: yes, we already taked about that but that's one of the things that also need information about the source  
tmortagne1 - (11:50): currently all you know is current document  
tmortagne1 - (11:51): pretty sure there is a jira issue for relative stuff  
vmassol - (11:51): btw I wonder if the rename will rename images too  
tmortagne1 - (11:52): vmassol: i dont think so  
tmortagne1 - (11:52): rename only rename links  
tmortagne1 - (11:52): AFAIK  
vmassol - (11:52): so that's another todo....  
tmortagne1 - (11:52): yep  
mflorea left at 12:00 (Quit: Leaving.  
abusenius joined #xwiki at 12:05  
tmortagne1 - (12:09): xwiki.org is still not using UTF8 ?  
sdumitriu - (12:10): No  
tmortagne1 - (12:10): ok  
sdumitriu - (12:10): Which is so bad  
tmortagne1 - (12:11): yep not very nice  
silviar left at 12:29 (Quit: Leaving.  
abusenius left at 12:34 (Ping timeout: 260 seconds  
lucaa left at 12:39 (Ping timeout: 245 seconds  
silviar joined #xwiki at 12:41  
mflorea joined #xwiki at 13:27  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 13:27  
vmassol - (13:29): guys I need some XWQL help  
vmassol - (13:29): anyone knows how to say "contains" in XWQL?  
vmassol - (13:29): for ex:  
vmassol - (13:29): #set ($xwql = "from doc.object(ExtensionCode.ExtensionClass) as extension where extension.type = 'application' and extension.bundledWith like 'XWiki Enterprise%'")  
vmassol - (13:29): I'd like to say that extension.bundledWith contains "XWiki Enterprise"  
vmassol - (13:29): but it shouldn't match "XWiki Enterprise Manager"  
vmassol - (13:30): hmm maybe I should use an id in the stati list  
vmassol - (13:30): will try this  
vmassol - (13:31): hmm before I do so I'd liek confirmation that I won't break the DB…. sdumitriu?  
vmassol - (13:31): currently we have the following for bundledWith:  
vmassol - (13:31): XWiki Enterprise|XWiki Enterprise Manager  
vmassol - (13:31): I'd like to modify it to be:  
vmassol - (13:31): enterprise=XWiki Enterprise|manager=XWiki Enterprise Manager  
Enygma` joined #xwiki at 13:32  
vmassol - (13:32): hmm I guess I'll just need to modify the sheet to use display() instead of getValue()  
vmassol - (13:32): is that it?  
sdumitriu - (13:32): Yes  
sdumitriu - (13:32): But note that all the existing values will be wrong  
vmassol - (13:32): ah that was my worry  
vmassol - (13:33): so no converison is performed  
sdumitriu - (13:33): No  
vmassol - (13:33): ok....  
sdumitriu - (13:33): But you can write a script  
vmassol - (13:33): any other way to do what I need in xwql?  
vmassol - (13:33): or is this really the best way?  
sdumitriu - (13:33): foreach doc, if value == "XWiki Enterprise" then set "enterprise", save  
sdumitriu - (13:34): What type is bundledWith?  
vmassol - (13:34): static list  
sdumitriu - (13:34): multiselect, relational storage?  
vmassol - (13:35): multiselect  
vmassol - (13:35): no relational storage  
sdumitriu - (13:35): Then there's no contains for it...  
vmassol - (13:36): ok so I guess the best is to have enterprise=XWiki Enterprise|manager=XWiki Enterprise Manager  
sdumitriu - (13:36): Yes  
vmassol - (13:36): ok… let's go for it...  
vmassol - (13:36): so 1) make the change in the class and 2) write a script to convert ?  
sdumitriu - (13:37): Yes  
vmassol - (13:37): ok thanks  
vmassol - (13:47): sdumitriu: is this ok:  
vmassol - (13:47):   #if ("$!bundled" == ["XWiki Enterprise", "XWiki Enterprise Manager"])  
vmassol - (13:47):     $pageDoc.set("bundledWith",  ["enterprise", "manager"]  
vmassol - (13:47):     $pageDoc.save("Fix bundledWith field", true)  
vmassol - (13:47):   #end  
abusenius joined #xwiki at 13:48  
vmassol - (13:49): yep seems to have worked  
vmassol - (13:51): a bit of spam  
sburjan - (13:52): nice script :)  
vmassol - (13:55): ok just need to fix the sheet now  
lucaa left at 14:01 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 14:01  
vmassol - (14:05): ok http://enterprise.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Features converted to use xwiki syntax 2.0 and to use the extensions wiki !  
vmassol - (14:06): :)  
lucaa1 joined #xwiki at 14:07  
tmortagne1 - (14:08): vmassol: very nice :)  
lucaa left at 14:08 (Ping timeout: 265 seconds  
tmortagne1 - (14:09): vmassol: ok to delete the test comment on http://enterprise.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Features ?  
vmassol - (14:09): yes :)  
tmortagne1 - (14:09): ok you already did that or the one how created it in the first place  
tmortagne1 - (14:10): s/how/who/  
lucaa1 left at 14:12 (Quit: Leaving.  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 14:12  
vmassol - (14:16): ok done for manager too: http://manager.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Features  
sburjan - (14:16): vmassol: quick question. Is there any way get some statistics from JIRA regarding only ONE XW Version (2.6). The problem is that I am interested in total issues platform-wide, not just for the XE Products.  
sburjan - (14:17): and XE Project from JIRA  
vmassol - (14:18): each jira project has its own version  
vmassol - (14:18): and own release cycle  
sburjan - (14:19): so for example I can't get a statistic regarding all the projects and their version used at building the XE (final product)  
vmassol - (14:19): you can but it's hard  
vmassol - (14:19): use JQL  
vmassol - (14:20): you'll need a jira JQL generator generated from our release plans ;)  
vmassol - (14:20): (tmortagne1)  
vmassol - (14:20): sburjan: for ex see dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Drafts/ReleasePlanJira  
vmassol - (14:22): sburjan: for ex:  
vmassol - (14:22): (project = "XWiki" and fixVersion="2.6") or (project = "XSCOLIBRI" and fixVersion = "1.18")  
vmassol - (14:22): etc  
Menso - (14:23): Has anyone made a sort of query builder or xwiki?  
vmassol - (14:23): ex:  
vmassol - (14:23): (project = "XWiki" and fixVersion="2.4 RC1") or (project = "XSCOLIBRI" and fixVersion = "1.18") or (project = "XTCONFRES" and fixVersion = "1.42") or (project = "XSKINX" and fixVersion = "1.16")  
vmassol - (14:24): !search query builder  
vmassol - (14:24): hmm not working :)  
vmassol - (14:25): Menso: maybe this: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/HQL+Query+Tester  
vmassol - (14:25): but it's not a builder  
vmassol - (14:25): I remember seeing something done  
vmassol - (14:25): but can't find it  
vmassol - (14:25): sburjan: do you get it?  
vmassol - (14:26): sburjan: see http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA041/Advanced+Searching?clicked=jirahelp  
Menso - (14:26): vmassol: ah, thanks… I was looking more for something which can list all the properties of a class and the user can select a property and enter what value it should have for a couple of fields so a user can easily query the data without having to know hql  
venkatna left at 14:26 (Remote host closed the connection  
vmassol - (14:26): Menso: I'm sure ludovic has something  
vmassol - (14:26): ;)  
Menso - (14:28): hehehe, it's amazing what he has or can create in no time vs what's on the public xwiki :-)  
vmassol - (14:28): yeah he's not always publishing stuff he creates  
Menso - (14:28): He also made some very slick treeview control per request which I think isn't on the wiki yet  
vmassol - (14:28): and he creates new stuff every day ;)  
vmassol - (14:29): Menso: have you checked our new extensions wiki btw?http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/  
vmassol - (14:29): do you like it?  
lucaa left at 14:29 (Ping timeout: 265 seconds  
vmassol - (14:30): sburjan: that gives http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&jqlQuery=(project+%3D+%22XWiki%22+and+fixVersion%3D%222.4+RC1%22)+or+(project+%3D+%22XSCOLIBRI%22+and+fixVersion+%3D+%221.18%22)+or+(project+%3D+%22XTCONFRES%22+and+fixVersion+%3D+%221.42%22)+or+(project+%3D+%22XSKINX%22+and+fixVersion+%3D+%221.16%22)  
sburjan - (14:30): vmassol: but first I create advanced queries, I'd need a list of all the versions of all the moduels included in the XE/XEM/Platform filter, right ?  
vmassol - (14:30): sburjan: yes that's on xwiki.org  
vmassol - (14:30): in the release plans  
vmassol - (14:30): if you create those filters, would be great to share them  
vmassol - (14:30): :)  
vmassol - (14:31): http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/ReleasePlans  
sburjan - (14:31): problem is the module versions get incremented by each release, right ?  
sburjan - (14:32): so I'll have to track them on each release, to see which changed  
vmassol - (14:32): sburjan: what module?  
vmassol - (14:32): yes when they are released  
vmassol - (14:32): not at each XE release  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 14:32  
vmassol - (14:32): yes it's a lot of work  
sburjan - (14:32): I have to create stats regarding XE (NOT the project) .. but the whole product  
vmassol - (14:33): tmortagne1 and I would like to generate this but that requires some coding and it's not there  
vmassol - (14:33): sburjan: that's a bad idea right now  
vmassol - (14:33): you should consider each jira project to be separate  
vmassol - (14:33): since they are separate  
sburjan - (14:33): silviar: suggested I should create a statistic showing how many issues wew fixed on 2.6 for example.  
vmassol - (14:34): it's too much work for you otherwise  
vmassol - (14:34): 2.6 doesn't mean anything  
sburjan - (14:34): XE 2.6 .. but not the Jira XE, but all the projects that are bundled in XE Enterprise  
sburjan - (14:34): do you get my point ?  
vmassol - (14:34): 2.6 doesn't mean anything for example for the blog application  
vmassol - (14:34): of course I get your point  
vmassol - (14:35): but you don't get mine!  
vmassol - (14:35): :)  
vmassol - (14:35): please read above  
vmassol - (14:35): s/read/re-read/  
sburjan - (14:35): I understand what you say. This was silviar 's suggestion, and I wanted to know your opinion about it  
vmassol - (14:36): ok  
sburjan - (14:36): looking for some KPI's :)  
sburjan - (14:36): also, it would be utopic if we could make somehow to be able to embed jira charts in xwiki pages.  
vmassol - (14:36): sburjan: we already dsicussed this  
sburjan - (14:37): I wasn't even able to embed jira charts on my iGoogle.  
vmassol - (14:37): and we already now how to do this  
sburjan - (14:37): vmassol: I know, i have to wait for gadgets impl  
lucaa left at 14:37 (Client Quit  
vmassol - (14:37): s/now/know/  
vmassol - (14:37): or find urls to images and simply reference external images  
sburjan - (14:38): hmm.. let me investigate that  
sburjan - (14:38): You can't even save a jira chart as an image.. you have to screenshot... maybe there is after all an image in the DOM that I can extract  
sburjan - (14:39): any status on the release ?  
vmassol - (14:39): sdumitriu: ?  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 14:39  
sdumitriu - (14:39): Finishing some tests, then I'll start it  
sburjan - (14:40): I'm not done testing yet. still have to test on IE's. So please don't release it tomorrow morning if you're able to build it today :)  
vmassol - (14:41): sburjan: we cannot wait for you  
vmassol - (14:41): we're already 1 week late  
vmassol - (14:41): sdumitriu: we need to decide if we do a RC2 or not… since RC23 is supposed to be today  
vmassol - (14:41): s/RC23/RC2/  
vmassol - (14:41): I'd say we go to final  
sdumitriu - (14:42): Well, I've been waiting for the release to become as stable as possible  
sdumitriu - (14:42): So I don't think we need another RC  
sdumitriu - (14:42): I'll just do the final next week  
vmassol - (14:43): k  
sburjan - (14:43): great :)  
sburjan - (14:43): so I still have time to test until final  
vmassol - (14:43): I'd suggest you send a mail though to warn everyone about the change of plan  
vmassol - (14:43): sburjan: it's very late already  
sburjan - (14:43): vmassol: I know, but in order to be effective, I prefer testing a release that is much close as possible to the final  
vmassol - (14:44): sburjan: that deosn't help us  
sburjan - (14:44): because If I test a late snapshot, i say it's ok and someone makes a commit that breaks something, i won't be able to catch it in time  
vmassol - (14:44): you might as well test after it's released  
vmassol - (14:44): it depends what your goal is  
sburjan - (14:44): you mean after the soft release  
vmassol - (14:44): whatever you test is useful  
vmassol - (14:44): but  
vmassol - (14:45): there are several strategies  
vmassol - (14:45): use your inputs for the next release  
vmassol - (14:45): use your inputs for the current version in developmen  
sburjan - (14:45): IMo we have decided that before announcing the release, an email is send so everybody willing can test. But if you say we are in a hurry, I guess that step will be removed  
vmassol - (14:45): for the latter we need it before the release happens because we need time to fix stuff  
vmassol - (14:46): so the earlier you test the better it is for devs  
sburjan - (14:46): I'm just trying to find the best period of the release cycle to test  
vmassol - (14:46): you have several tyoes of tests IMO  
vmassol - (14:47): when a new feature is added for ex is a good time to test that feature  
lucaa left at 14:47 (Quit: Leaving.  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 14:47  
vmassol - (14:47): then you have smoke tests or sanity checks  
vmassol - (14:47): etc  
vmassol - (14:48): I could help you  
vmassol - (14:48): but I'd need to see first what tests you're doing  
vmassol - (14:48): ie the test plan  
vmassol - (14:49): (each major release need a test plan)  
sburjan - (14:49): yes, I will do that.. but it will take some time.. I hope I can start it after the release. I have to study all those pages from drafts, create a merge, and the present it for feedback  
vmassol - (14:49): (which can be built from a generic test plan and instantiated for a given release with specifics for that release)  
vmassol - (14:49): well if you're testing it means you already have a test plan :)  
vmassol - (14:49): because I guess you don't test at randome  
sburjan - (14:49): yes. Like we have for release process (each built module is checked in the list), etc  
vmassol - (14:50): and even if you do it's alreayd a test plan  
vmassol - (14:50): ;)  
sburjan - (14:50): well not quite random :)  
vmassol - (14:50): (not an optimal one though)  
jstoldt - (14:50): small question about the colibri skin, i notice this since XE 2.5; the edit buttons for each section look a little funny. it's like this: http://img716.imageshack.us/img716/9772/editj.png  
jstoldt - (14:50): is this by design?  
vmassol - (14:51): jstoldt: what is the Be?  
jstoldt - (14:51): it should be "Bearbeiten"  
jstoldt - (14:51): in german  
jstoldt - (14:51): which is "edit"  
jstoldt - (14:51): but it does not show correctly for sections here  
jstoldt - (14:53): at least not on Opera 10.63 and IE 7  
sburjan - (14:54): sdumitriu: did we fixed the Activity Stream regarding deleted pages version errors in console ?  
sdumitriu - (14:54): sabageru: Did we?  
jstoldt - (14:55): i'll be gone for a while  
tmortagne1 left at 14:56 (Quit: Leaving.  
tmortagne joined #xwiki at 14:56  
sdumitriu - (14:57): sburjan: Was there an issue for it?
